news.title: Trump puts extra 100% tariff on China imports, adds export controls on 'critical software'
news.summary: President Trump retaliated against China's export controls on rare earths. He also suggested he also would cancel a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

news.title: OpenAI's dominance is unlike anything Silicon Valley has ever seen
news.summary: OpenAI's position at the heart of the AI boom, and its expansion up and down the stack, is putting it in competition with a growing list of startups.

news.title: Tech megacaps lose $770 billion in value as Nasdaq suffers steepest drop since April
news.summary: Nvidia dropped almost 5%, pacing a steep decline in tech stocks, after President Trump threatened more tariffs on China. Nvidia is a chipmaker that makes chips for PCs and mobile devices.

news.title: Trump says 'a lot' of federal workers are being laid off during government shutdown
news.summary: The Trump administration and Republicans have sought to blame Democrats for the government shutdown, and any negative fallout from it. The shutdown began on Dec. 22 and is now in its third week.

news.title: Apple nears deal to acquire talent and technology from computer vision startup Prompt AI
news.summary: Apple is in late-stage talks with startup Prompt AI to bring on the company's employees and its computer vision technology. Prompt AI is based in San Francisco.

news.title: ‘I watch antenna TV’: I’m 66. Will I lose my disability benefits if Social Security goes belly up?
news.summary: “I read that the Social Security Disability Insurance Trust Fund is good until 2099,” he says. “I’m glad that’s the case.”

news.title: If New York or California enter a recession, the entire U.S. economy would be next. So how are they doing?
news.summary: As two of the biggest states in the country, their economies ”may be canaries in the coal mine,” one economist notes.

news.title: My sister is 65. She has $80,000 in bonds and savings, and $2,600 a month in Social Security. Can she retire?
news.summary: “She is single and makes $55,000 a year,” a source said. “She’s not a bad person,’ the source added. ‘She has a good heart.’

news.title: How can Anthropic stand out in the AI wars? I went to a Greenwich Village pop-up to find out.
news.summary: Anthropic’s brand-awareness effort drew thousands as the company competes for consumer attention amid increasing competition. Anthropic: “We’re here to make you feel good about yourself.”

news.title: ‘I can’t stop thinking about money’: I’m struggling with guilt over my $135K in financial mistakes. How do I move on?
news.summary: “We aren’t in debt outside of our mortgage, but I feel sick when I think about the money,” she says.
